output.conclusion: This course provides a foundational understanding of the principles governing the behavior of machines. Further study in specific areas like robotics, automation, or advanced mechanical design is highly recommended.
output.introduction: Welcome to the Theory of Machines! This course will introduce you to the fundamental concepts behind how machines work, focusing on motion, forces, and energy transfer. No prior knowledge is assumed.

chapters.description: What is a mechanism? Definition and examples. Difference between machines and mechanisms. Basic components: links, joints, and frames.
Understanding the difference between kinematics (motion) and kinetics (forces causing motion). Examples illustrating each concept.
Introduction to different types of motion: translation, rotation, and complex motion. Examples of each in everyday machines.
What are degrees of freedom (DOF)? How to determine the DOF of a simple mechanism. Examples with one and two DOF.
Introduction to the four-bar linkage: a fundamental mechanism. Identifying the links and joints. Applications of four-bar linkages.
Understanding the crank-rocker mechanism: a type of four-bar linkage. How it works and common applications.
What is a cam? Basic cam terminology: cam profile, follower, base circle. Different types of cam followers.
Understanding basic cam motion profiles: uniform motion, simple harmonic motion. Visualizing cam motion.
What are gears? Basic gear terminology: teeth, pitch, diameter. Different types of gears: spur, helical, bevel.
Understanding gear ratios and their importance. Calculating gear ratios for simple gear trains.
Introduction to power transmission in machines. How power is transferred through mechanisms.
Understanding the concept of efficiency in machines. Factors affecting efficiency.
